questions.text: A practical current source is represented by an ideal current source in parallel with a:
The Quality Factor (Q) of a series RLC circuit is a measure of the circuit's:

choices.text: Bandwidth relative to its resonant frequency

questions.text: In a BJT, the collector current is primarily controlled by the:
A JFET (Junction Field-Effect Transistor) is considered a "normally ON" device because:

choices.text: It requires a positive gate voltage to conduct.
It conducts when the gate-to-source voltage is zero.
It is always in the saturation region.

questions.text: An op-amp is configured as a differentiator. What is its primary disadvantage in practical applications?

choices.text: It has a very low gain.
It is unstable and tends to amplify high-frequency noise.
It can only process DC signals.
It has a very low input impedance.

questions.text: The "Miller effect" in a transistor amplifier describes the apparent increase in the:

choices.text: Input capacitance due to feedback from the output

questions.text: What is a "static hazard" in a combinational circuit?

choices.text: A permanent fault in the circuit.
A condition where the output changes multiple times for a single input change.
The power consumed by the circuit when inputs are not changing.
An unwanted momentary change in the output which should have remained constant.

questions.text: The primary difference between a PAL (Programmable Array Logic) and a PLA (Programmable Logic Array) is that:

choices.text: PAL has a programmable AND array and a fixed OR array; PLA has both programmable.
PLA has a programmable AND array and a fixed OR array; PAL has both programmable.
PAL is used for sequential logic, PLA for combinational.
PLA is an older technology than PAL.

questions.text: The "setup time" is the minimum time the data input of a flip-flop must be stable:

choices.text: During the low phase of the clock.

questions.text: A "control hazard" in a CPU pipeline is caused by:

choices.text: An instruction depending on the result of a previous instruction.
Two instructions needing the same hardware resource at the same time.
A branch instruction that changes the normal flow of execution.

questions.text: I/O-mapped I/O (or port-mapped I/O) uses a separate address space for I/O devices, requiring special instructions like:
In C, what is the behavior of the expression i++ + ++i?

choices.text: It is a reliable way to increment i twice.
It is defined to execute the pre-increment first.

questions.text: In C++, what is the "Rule of Three/Five"?

choices.text: A rule of thumb that if a class defines any of a copy constructor, copy assignment operator, or destructor, it should probably define all three (or five, including move semantics).
A class cannot have more than three private members.
A class can inherit from at most five other classes.
A template can have at most three parameters.

questions.text: What is a "lambda expression" in modern C++?

choices.text: A way to define an anonymous function object.
A keyword for dynamic memory allocation.

questions.text: A "Translation Lookaside Buffer" (TLB) is a cache used by the MMU to:

choices.text: Speed up the translation of virtual addresses to physical addresses.
Cache data from the main memory.

questions.text: In the context of RTOS, "jitter" refers to the:

choices.text: Time it takes for a task to execute.
Variation in the latency of an event or task execution.
Number of tasks in the ready queue.
Time spent in a context switch.

questions.text: TCP's "Fast Retransmit" mechanism is triggered when:

choices.text: The sender receives three duplicate acknowledgments for the same segment.
The receiver's window size becomes zero.

questions.text: Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) is the routing protocol used for routing:

choices.text: Within a single Autonomous System (interior gateway protocol).
Between different Autonomous Systems (exterior gateway protocol).

questions.text: What is a "rainbow table" attack used for?

choices.text: Cracking password hashes by using a precomputed table of hashes.

questions.text: The Pumping Lemma for context-free languages is used to prove that a language is:
In 3D graphics, a "normal vector" at a point on a surface is a vector that is:

choices.text: Tangent to the surface at that point.
Perpendicular to the surface at that point.

questions.text: Kruskal's algorithm for finding the MST sorts all the edges by weight and adds them to the tree if they:

choices.text: Do not form a cycle with the existing edges in the tree.

questions.text: The ROLLBACK command in a database transaction is used to:

choices.text: Undo all the changes made by the transaction.

questions.text: Which page replacement algorithm suffers from Belady's Anomaly?
"Cohesion" in software design refers to the measure of how strongly related and focused the responsibilities of a single module are. Which form of cohesion is considered the best?
The "State" design pattern is a behavioral pattern that:

choices.text: Ensures a class has only one instance.
Allows an object to alter its behavior when its internal state changes.
Defines a family of algorithms and makes them interchangeable.
Provides a placeholder for another object.

questions.text: First-Order Logic (FOL) can represent the statement "All engineers are smart" as:
In machine learning, what is "regularization"?

choices.text: The process of normalizing the input data.
A technique used to prevent overfitting by adding a penalty term to the loss function.
The process of selecting the best model.
The process of training a model.

questions.text: Earned Value (EV) in project management is:

choices.text: The total budget for the project.
The actual cost incurred to date.
The budgeted cost of the work that has actually been completed.
The planned cost of the work scheduled.

questions.text: Which of the following represents a potential conflict of interest for an engineer?

choices.text: Using a standard, well-known component in a design.
Specifying the use of a product manufactured by a company in which the engineer has a significant financial interest.
Working overtime to meet a project deadline.

questions.text: In a parallel resonant circuit, the impedance at resonance is:
A "Johnson Counter" is a variation of a:
In C++, what is SFINAE (Substitution Failure Is Not An Error)?

choices.text: A principle in template metaprogramming that allows for compile-time decisions based on whether a certain type substitution is valid.

questions.text: What is a "data hazard" in a pipeline?

choices.text: When an instruction cannot execute because the required hardware is busy.
When an instruction's execution depends on the result of a previous, unfinished instruction.
When a branch instruction is encountered.
When a memory access takes too long.

questions.text: The primary purpose of the "spanning tree protocol" (STP) in an Ethernet network is to:

choices.text: Find the shortest path between two nodes.
Prevent broadcast storms by disabling loops in a redundant switched network.

questions.text: A problem is "NP-complete" if it is in the class NP and:

choices.text: It can be solved in polynomial time.
Every problem in NP can be reduced to it in polynomial time.
It can be verified in exponential time.

questions.text: A B-Tree is a self-balancing tree data structure that is optimized for:

choices.text: Systems that read and write large blocks of data (disks)

questions.text: The "Dining Philosophers" problem is a classic OS problem used to illustrate:

choices.text: The challenges of deadlock and starvation in concurrent systems.

questions.text: In software engineering, "technical debt" is a concept that reflects:

choices.text: The total financial cost of a software project.
The implied cost of rework caused by choosing an easy solution now instead of using a better approach that would take longer.
The number of bugs in the software.
The amount of time spent on documentation.

questions.text: "Backward chaining" is an inference method used in expert systems that works backward from:

choices.text: The initial facts to a conclusion.
A potential conclusion (goal) to see if there is evidence to support it.

questions.text: What is a key difference between a MOSFET and a BJT?

choices.text: A MOSFET is a current-controlled device, while a BJT is a voltage-controlled device.
A BJT is a current-controlled device, while a MOSFET is a voltage-controlled device.
MOSFETs are only used for digital circuits.
BJTs have a much higher input impedance.

questions.text: A "race-around" condition can occur in which type of flip-flop?
What is "RAII" (Resource Acquisition Is Initialization) in C++?

choices.text: A design idiom that binds the life cycle of a resource to the lifetime of an object.
A way to handle runtime errors.

questions.text: What is the "fast-forward" merge in a version control system like Git?

choices.text: A merge where the tip of the target branch is an ancestor of the source branch.
A merge that results in a merge conflict.
A merge that creates a new merge commit.
A merge that discards the history of one of the branches.

questions.text: Which of the following is a "link-state" routing protocol?
The Cohen-Sutherland algorithm is used for:
The "ACID" properties of a transaction stand for:
In object-oriented design, the "Strategy" pattern allows:

choices.text: An object to change its behavior when its state changes.
Defining a family of algorithms, encapsulating each one, and making them interchangeable.
Ensuring a class has only one instance.
Attaching additional responsibilities to an object.

questions.text: What is the "bias-variance tradeoff" in machine learning?

choices.text: A model with high bias pays little attention to the training data and oversimplifies, while a model with high variance pays too much attention and overfits.
The tradeoff between the speed and accuracy of a model.
The tradeoff between the number of features and the number of training examples.
The tradeoff between precision and recall.

questions.text: According to the NEC's code of conduct, an engineer must:

choices.text: Prioritize their employer's profit above all else.
Inform their client or employer of any business connections or interests which might influence their judgment.
Attempt to injure the professional reputation of another engineer.
Accept compensation from more than one party for the same service without the consent of all parties.

questions.text: The "duty cycle" of a periodic waveform is the ratio of:

choices.text: The time the signal is active to the total period.
The total period to the time the signal is active.
The peak amplitude to the average amplitude.

questions.text: A "Finite State Machine" (FSM) is an abstract machine that can be in exactly one of a finite number of:
In C, void * is a generic pointer that:

choices.text: Can point to any data type.
Is a pointer that points to nothing.

questions.text: In TCP congestion control, the "slow start" phase:
The problem of "determining if a string belongs to a context-free language" is:
"Cyclomatic complexity" is a software metric used to measure the:

choices.text: Complexity of a program's control flow.

questions.text: The "perceptron" learning algorithm is guaranteed to converge if:

choices.text: The number of features is large.

questions.text: "Earned Value Management" (EVM) integrates:
An engineer discovering a design error that could pose a public safety risk after a project is complete has an ethical obligation to:

choices.text: Inform their employer or client and any appropriate authorities.

questions.text: A "page fault" is a type of:

choices.text: Exception or trap generated by the hardware when a process accesses a page not in physical memory

questions.text: An amplifier has a voltage gain of 40 dB. If the input voltage is 10 mV, what is the output voltage? ($A_{v_dB} = 20 \times \log_{10}(V_{out}/V_{in})$)

A 5-bit synchronous counter is built using JK flip-flops. If the propagation delay of each flip-flop is 12 ns and the AND gate used for logic has a delay of 8 ns, what is the maximum clock frequency the counter can operate at?

choices.text: Base Constructor, Derived Constructor, Base Destructor
Base Constructor, Derived Constructor, Derived Destructor, Base Destructor
Base Constructor, Derived Constructor, Base Destructor, Derived Destructor
The code has a memory leak.

questions.text: A system has a 24-bit virtual address, a 16-bit physical address, and a 2 KB page size. How many virtual pages and how many physical frames are there in this system?

Consider a network using the Go-Back-N protocol with a window size of 4 and a sequence number space of 8 (0-7). If the sender has sent packets 0, 1, 2, 3 and receives an ACK for packet 1, what new packets can the sender transmit?

choices.text: No new packets until packet 0 is ACKed.

questions.text: A 2D point (2, 3) is subjected to a composite transformation: first, a rotation of -90 degrees (clockwise) about the origin, and second, a reflection about the x-axis. What are the final coordinates?

choices.text: Yes, a safe sequence exists (e.g., P3, P1, P0, P2).
Yes, a safe sequence exists (e.g., P1, P0, P3, P2).
No, the system is in an unsafe state.

questions.text: A project has a Budget at Completion (BAC) of $500,000. At a certain point, the Earned Value (EV) is $200,000, and the Actual Cost (AC) is $250,000. What is the Cost Performance Index (CPI), and what does it indicate?

choices.text: CPI = 1.25, the project is under budget.
CPI = 1.25, the project is over budget.
CPI = 0.8, the project is over budget.
CPI = 0.8, the project is under budget.

questions.text: In the RSA algorithm, p=7, q=11, e=13. What is the ciphertext for the plaintext message M=5?

What does the following SQL query do?
SELECT e1.Name FROM Employees e1, Employees e2 WHERE e1.ManagerID = e2.ID AND e1.Salary > e2.Salary;

choices.text: It lists all employees and their managers.
It lists all managers who earn more than their employees.
It lists all employees who earn more than their direct manager.
The query is invalid due to a self-join.

questions.text: A control flow graph for a program has 10 nodes, 12 edges, and 2 connected components. What is its cyclomatic complexity? ($M = E - N + 2P$)
What is the number of distinct simple graphs (undirected, no self-loops) that can be constructed with 3 labeled vertices?
In a system with a 20-bit address bus and a 16-bit data bus, what is the maximum memory capacity and the word size?
What does the regular expression [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9]* typically represent?

choices.text: A valid identifier in many programming languages

questions.text: An A* search algorithm expands a node n. The path cost from the start to n, g(n), is 10. The heuristic estimate to the goal, h(n), is 5. The actual cost from n to the goal is 8. Is the heuristic admissible for this instance?
A system's memory consists of partitions of sizes 150K, 350K, 200K, and 400K. In what partition will a new process requiring 180K of memory be placed using the "Best Fit" algorithm?
Which design pattern would be used to create a complex object step by step, allowing the construction process to create different representations of the object?
What is the primary risk of not using a virtual destructor in a base class from which other classes are derived?

choices.text: A memory leak can occur if a derived class object is deleted through a base class pointer.
The base class constructor will not be called.

questions.text: A 4-bit parallel-in, serial-out (PISO) shift register is loaded with the data 1101. If the clock is pulsed 3 times, what will be the serial output? (Assume the LSB is shifted out first).
A project has a Planned Value (PV) of $1000, an Earned Value (EV) of $900, and an Actual Cost (AC) of $800. What is the status of the project?

choices.text: Ahead of schedule and under budget.
Ahead of schedule and over budget.
